Reviews.Title: “Quiet place to relax”
Reviews.Author: Ehusain
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at AC Gava Mar from 19-22 April. The hotel is situated iin a residential area , on the mediteranian sea. It is vey quiet and the place is very romantic. The staff is very helpful. We have enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gava Mar: Quiet and Peaceful away from the city”
Reviews.Author: Nikki L
Reviews.Content: Gava Mar is a wonderful hotel away from the city lights of Barcelona where one can relax and enjoy a peaceful stay. The hotel is modern where one can relax and enjoy a cocktail by the poolside or enjoy the surf of the beach which is 50 meters away from the pool. Although the staff is professional they are quite distant with regards to American staff. One must continue asking questions in order to find out more about the area or things to do around Gava Mar. There isn't much to do unless, you are into running, exercising and enjoying a peaceful weekend or for a special event then it is ideal. The rooms are average size but convenient and have a wonderful view of the vast park and poolside as well as the sea. My idea of staying at a hotel is convenience so Gava Mar is a place that I recommend. Nevertheless, it does have its inconveniences such as boisterous children who are accompanied by families during the high season. Unfortunately, they are not well versed in being in a public atmosphere where they scream around the poolside or dive in the pool with such vigor that many times I left to the beach for rest and relaxation. I highly recommend that they have a person survey this area since it is important to have a peaceful stay. Also, they should clean the poolside area more often as it tends to become less attractive when guests leave their towels, newspapers, ashtrays around. The reception area is quite large with a wide screen television and seating to watch the news or football matches. Also, they have WIFI so its better to work there than in your room as its spacious and people rarely go there. The restaurant is nothing to rave about since we had dinner there once... it was disappointing. its better to go across the street to the famous tapas restaurant a few hundred meters away to the right of the hotel. The breakfast room is small but one can find a buffet style breakfast with everything so that is a plus. Again, if you want scrambled eggs, you must ask for it. It's a bit noisy since it has a combination of family/convention/couples as guests so either get up very early or very late to avoid the rush and noise. Overall: Rooms: Clean and practical Minibar: free orange juice, bottled water and coke/beer...great! Bath/toilet: clean and spacious Spa/gym: one must go to a facility that the hotel recommends that isn't too far off but its quite busy. The hotel should build one on its vast property for its guests. Pool: good size but should build a children or family pool on the opposite side of the park. Price: between €230-350 for a night which is pricey outside of Barcelona Restaurant: I recommend eating out Breakfast: €15 (all you can eat) buffet, a bit pricey for Spain. Location: near the airport but in a peaceful residential area Staff: Professional but need to be more friendly towards guests Recommendation: Have the staff survey the noise (noisy children), which is impossible. Anecdote: Gava Mar is an exclusive residential area where television hosts and football stars have a secondary home (near the airport). Its a nice place and will continue to frequent Gava Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice out of town hotel”
Reviews.Author: G V
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice with modern style rooms. I got a room with a front sea view and it was very nice. The room itself was very nice furbished with all needed equipments. The hotel overall is very nice and modern as well. The buffet breakfast was not that big but sufficient and good. Unfortunately, and due to the season, I couldn't profit from the beach which is couple of feet from the hotel. Finally, it is +/- 20 minutes from Barcelona dowtown. Worth to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good out of town hotel near beach”
Reviews.Author: EM12Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: I was staying here on business for 2 nights and is around 12km from Barcelona and therefore you don't pay the premium prices for central Barcelona if you don't mind the travel into the city. I was here in November so didn't take advantage of the beach or the swimming pool but I would imagine that it would be lovely in summer. Rooms are modern and all usual facilities and includes free mini bar with soft drinks and a couple of bottles of beer which is a nice touch not to have to pay for water and orange juice etc.Breakfast is continental with no hot food but offers ham, bread rolls, croissants, cakes and fresh fruit but I felt to be a few euros overpriced at 16 euros. The hotel is in a residential area and I agree with another reviewer that useful to have the address to give to the taxi driver. I would recommend this hotel if happy to stay out of town

Reviews.Title: “Barcelona & beach”
Reviews.Author: criparius
Reviews.Content: Nice & stylish hotel right on the beach only 10 min away from Barcelona airport (have the address ready, not all cab drivers know where the hotel is located) The rooms are well designed and very modern (free minibar is a nice extra). There is no balcony, but you can open the large windows (and see & hear the sea!). There is free wi-fi in the lobby. The beach is great for watching the sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Extra for this, extra for that, extra for........”
Reviews.Author: artd67
Reviews.Content: A stylish, modern hotel, that is clean and well presented. Close to the airport (10 mins by cab for 20 Euro) but, thankfully, away from the noise and hubub. The local area has a sprinkling of shops and bars. The public areas are bright and airy, the pool and terrace well tended. The spacious garden leads directly onto the beach. My room, 212, had a direct, unhindered view across the pool and gardens to the sea. There is no balcony but there are large double, patio style doors. My real issue with this hotel is that the charging structure appears to be run along similar lines to a budget airline. Extra for internet, 12 Euro, extra for parking, 14 Euro per day, extra for breakfast, 16 Euro. They do offer free internet in reception but I do not consider this acceptable when travelling on business. Any hotel that activly chooses to inconvenience it's guests for the sake of a quick hidden charge will not get my repeat business. The location is fine, the rooms are fine, the facilities are fine. But I checked out with the kind of feeling that must accompany beeing robbed in the street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to be close to airport”
Reviews.Author: ld1128
Reviews.Content: This Marriott is a nice hotel, steps from the beach and close to the airport (30 Euro cab ride). The staff was nice, room was clean and bed was ok. It was a hot October day, and the air conditioning is shut off the end of Sept, but we could open the window. Nice pool and patio area. Free Wifi in the lobby, which had complimentary coffee, tea and pastries in the afternoon. Best part of stay was the lovely Chez Bea, creperie on the little main street. It's a quiet little beach area, fine for a one night stay before heading to the airport. Only negative - come on Marriott let's get some new linens! Really holes in the bed sheets? We expect more from a Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Well...Nice hotel but it's on a sleeping pill”
Reviews.Author: touringtheworldyoung
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 day after returning from a meditarrean cruise. I like to have fun when I travel so here goes........ If you like to club, this hotline is not for you. Very quiet and everybody behaves. Pros: Nice, sleek, chic Euro style furniture (kinda like Ikea) Very clean On beach & pool Close to airport Staff nice Free minibar with spanish birra (don't get excited) Walking distance to tapas, restaurants & bar Cons: No currency exchange 1 channel in English (they will CNN you to death) No shuttle to airport Small rooms, but heyyyy were not in the USA right? No bar (I was told the hostess,waitress,cook would make you a drink) lol No wireless in room. You have to come downstairs to the common area. No business center to print boarding passes. Would I return again? Yes.... Next time I'll bring plenty of DVDs & tuck my party mood away. -njoy

Reviews.Title: “Alternative location close to BCN airport”
Reviews.Author: Alexlui
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located when you need to stay close to El Prat airport. Furniture are modern and comfortable, location is good to reach Barca centre, about 30 minutes driving, and very good to go to the beaches of Gava and Castelldefels. Restaurant is good and dishes are well prepared with some Catalan specialties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel beside the beach”
Reviews.Author: Lynda0c
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying in this hotel for 10 days. It was a really lovely place to stay. The rooms and facilities were wonderful and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. It is located right beside the beach, plus the pool and surrounding area is very pleasant to spend a few hours sunning yourself! The buffet breakfast is a bit expensive and was extra, but was free for our 11 year old, having said that, the breakfast was very good. There is a very helpful tourist office up the road, and there is a bus stop only 5 minutes away, which has a bus that brings you directly into Barcelona - cheap and very efficient! The only negative I would have is the availability of restaurants in the immediate Gava Mar area, there were very few - although there is one restaurant - Torreon, which is just a hundred metres from the hotel, that was very good, although a little on the expensive side for Spain, but worth it. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those with a car. I would give the hotel a five rating, but feel it could improve on its offering of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel near the Barcelona Airport”
Reviews.Author: cakLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for one night before leaving Spain. It was a great location -- just a few steps from the beautiful beach. The service and room in the hotel were great. I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great For a One Night Stay Post Cruise”
Reviews.Author: CC6169
Reviews.Content: AC Gava Mar is a great alternative if you need a hotel near BCN Airport. We spent the night her after a cruise before flying back to the US. I was about to book the Renaissance BCN when I noticed this came up as an option on Marriott.com (AC Hotels are now a part of Marriott but you cannot earn points etc until later in 2011) and booked instead. The hotel is in a pretty quiet beach area about 10 minutes from BCN but has gorgeously landscaped grounds with a great pool and is feet from the beach. After a few nights in downtown Barcelona followed by the week long cruise it was the perfect option for a relaxing one-night stay (at a great value as well- app 80EUR). The only problem is there are no really good connections to BCN or Barcelona with the exception of taxi. There are also only a couple restaurants in the area so I wouldn't recommend more than a 1 or 2 night stay . The hotel itself is very modern yet functional. They say every room has a sea view but I think the ground floor rooms can only see the beautiful grounds/pool and not all the way to the beach. We were on the second floor and had a decent ocean view. The rooms are large and what you would expect from a Marriott associated hotel. Nice perk is the free mini-bar...There were a few bottles of mineral water, fresh juice, sodas, and 2 bottles of San Miguel (one of which was non-alcoholic). I'm not sure if it is daily but when we were there on a Sunday they had set up an outdoor cafe by the pool with an extensive buffet (25EUR) and other options for sandwiches etc. The cheeseburger was actually quite impressive. I'm sure that AC becoming a part of Marriott this hotel will gain in popularity but hope they keep their current service standards. A huge plus would be to add an airport shuttle or a shuttle downtown like the Renaissance offers.

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel in a clean area”
Reviews.Author: M0rgan77
Reviews.Content: Located at the beach front doesn't give you the impression to be in a hectic tourist area. It is rather a distinguished area, with plenty of opportunities to relax in quiteness and still have the possibility to use optimal sports facilities. Breakfast choice is very good and restaurant crew very helpful and friendly (and not to forget, minibar is free). I was there for business and will next time go back to this location, for business or for leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Potentially a wonderful hotel but I felt that we were let down.”
Reviews.Author: jcprobinson
Reviews.Content: Hotel Report - AC Gava Mar, Catalunya In a lovely location between the wonderful cities of Barcelona and Tarragona, the AC Gava Mar Hotel immediately creates a very good impression with it’s smart modern architecture; the building insides impresses similarly. The views from the bedrooms across the large well tended hotel garden are very relaxing; overlooking both the hotel’s private sumptuous swimming pool and about 50 metres beyond, the beach and the Mediterranean Sea. When the sun is shining, as it often was for us (in Apr – May), the sight of the waves was very enjoyable. The hotel cleaning staff were very good. The restaurant nearest to the hotel was superb; all the others we went to during our stay were very good. We enjoyed our stay. However… Most disappointingly, the hotel maintenance electrician was not competent. When we arrived, whilst investigating why the TV did not work, one of the mains power sockets fell out of the wall exposing lethal voltages. The hotel Manager called hotel maintenance. The hotel maintenance man came, screwed the socket back in to the wall and said it was now safe, but it was not. After he left, the socket fell out again. Mostly, the hotel staffs were very responsive. One of the receptionists later in our stay was very helpful, going out of her way to assist us in providing light bulbs. However, I had never got the room heating control to work – advice from a receptionist early in our stay was dismissively “you won’t get cooling until next month” (I had sought her advice because the printed room guide, amongst a number of deficiencies, said nothing about how to get the heating control to work). I did not get the room heating/cooling system to work in “the next month” (May) either. After the first night with the room becoming too hot for me (27 Deg C) I vacated the room at 4 in the morning, for a cooler time in the Hotel lounge. Subsequently, I opened the room sea-ward door to provide cooling - this proved effective, even if the window mosquito nets did not; my wife suffered 8 mosquito bites over our last 3 nights. After we had first reported the electrical problem, the hotel manager had arranged some gifts to be placed in our en-suite, after our second complaint, and us being moved to a new room, the gifts failed to materialise. We had to wait at reception on our arrival. We then had to move to a new room as the first was unsafe. I then had to return for the third time to reception as the second room was deficient a pillow. It took 55 minutes to get our room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but nothing quite works.”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTraveller21
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel in a quiet spot directly on the beach. I was quite prepared to like this hotel. It's informal and well-designed, and the neighbourhood, is quiet, charming and not far from the airport. The breakfast buffet was nice. The place had a calm, pleasant, relaxed atmosphere. But alas, nothing quite worked as it should. It's not labelled clearly from the street, and the taxi drop-off is at the opposite end of the hotel from the front door. The wireless internet was spotty. The shower screen lets water splash everywhere. The drain on the bathtub didn't work. The stereo had no power cord to plug into the wall. No safe in the room. And the desk clerk seemed to enjoy declaring how little she could do to remedy the situation. But still, the price was reasonable for a beachside hotel, so one shouldn't complain. But bear in mind that there's little public transport in the neighbourhood, so your savings may be eaten up in taxi fares--€35 each way to the centre of Barcelona. It's definitely for those on a motoring holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieke18
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was very good. You have the beach at 100m away from the swimming pool and a bus stop to barcelona 500m from the hotel. The room was very clean and we had a refill of the free minibar every day. Only that the airco in the breakfast room was to cold in the morning was less.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictorMonterrey
Reviews.Content: Quiet and exclusive zone, very good hotel, it is out of Barcelona, needs a car t move on, but the hotel is nice and very good design.

Reviews.Title: “Yesss!”
Reviews.Author: iaga84
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel, nice price :D 50mt from beach. Elegant and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Efficient and functional”
Reviews.Author: NicL
Reviews.Content: Very out of town (30 mins to city centre) in a nice, fairly well-heeled coastal neighbourhood, the hotel is clean and pretty comfortable. Room was fine, quite a good size and quite modern. The bed must've been good as I slept like a log on both nights, but that could also have been rioja-assisted. Breakfast was good in a nice airey space. No real bar or restaurant to the hotel to speak of which means that you have to travel to find that, which isn't always what one wants. Best thing about the hotel - undoubtedly the friendly, helpful and courteous staff. Would i stay here again - no, almost certainly not.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel located directly at the beach”
Reviews.Author: mikeangel86
Reviews.Content: The AC Gava Mar is located few minutes away from the Barcelona Airport directly at the beach. From every room you have a wonderful view to the hotel own parc and the sandy beach just behind. The rooms are very clean and were cleaned every day. We could use the minibar for free (I think this is just because we were there in autumn). The staff at the reception is very kindly and does every thing you are asking for. With the bus (L95), stopping just a hundered meter away from the hotel, you can travel to Barcelona (Placa Catalunya) for only 1.35 Euro. Tipp: booking a room in the upper floors guarantees you a wonderful view out of your bed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel ,excellent location, by the sea and near Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: JoseSM
Reviews.Content: Nice a calm beach and good local bar with good 'sangria' and tapas.

Reviews.Title: “I don't want to tell you about it..you might go there!”
Reviews.Author: mpgm
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel right on the beach. Good rooms and excellent restaurants and tapas bars locally. Lovely pool but not for Olympic swimmers! Beautiful outdoor area with lots of room to be private. Staff very helpful and went out of their way to be of assistance. Bus to Barcelona closeby (40 mins.) and great value at E1.35 each way. Very respectable area and yet quiet and well policed. Probably would not suit the disco set,but for us a good choice at a fair price...but don't tell anyone else about it!

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel right on beach”
Reviews.Author: Peter071
Reviews.Content: A very modern minimalist hotel right on the beach 10 minutes from the airport and 20 minutes from Barcelona city centre. Rooms very well equipped, clean and spacious all with an uninterupted sea view. King size bed. Tv, cd player and a/c. Free minibar - mainly soft drinks. Free wifi. Extensive gardens with swimming pool and direct beach access. Staff friendly, helpful and all speak English. Breakfast good value at 13 euros.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Novision
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on business. Nice friendly hotel. Clean and modern. In the middle of housing but back straight on to miles of golden beach. Next to a sports club which I think you can use. Doesn't have a real bar - you have to sit in the lounge and hope a waiter comes by, which is a bit irritating after a long day. However, the room has free soft drinks in the mini-bar. Rooms very clean and smart. Bed very comfortable. Shower was great as was the all glass sink which has been mentioned elsewhere. Restaurant didn't open until 8-30pm and only had a few guests all night so not much atmosphere. Bit obscure to find. My taxi had to put is sat nav on and still got a bit lost. Overall a nice hotel - but needs a bit more atmosphere. Great location for the beach though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and modern Hotel - all rooms with sea view”
Reviews.Author: GAP15
Reviews.Content: Nice and very modern hotel. The room was clean and had transparent glass sink. This is something that I have never seen in a hotel and it underlines the cleanness. Please note that the hotel is not in Barcelona but in small city on the sea near the BCN airport. The beach is nice and wide. There is a gym just next to the hotel that can be used for free. The real downside is the food. Breakfast, lunch and dinner are really very basic and poor. I suggest to dine out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but,”
Reviews.Author: ROCKINGROD
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, but a little remote for me. The hotel was fantastic, probably the best I have ever stayed in. However, there were a small number of things that spolied it for me. No money changing facilities. They closed the pool a week before we got there. Shops etc were a 10 euro taxi fare. I advise you to take a map of the hotel as we had a problem at the airport. For a great steak, La Pampa Argentine restaurant is perfect. You will have to book. If you want a break in peace and quiet this is the hotel for you. By the way there is no bar but waiter service in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous find!!”
Reviews.Author: cruisin-the-world
Reviews.Content: I have to say that i was nervous when booking this hotel because it had no previous reviews written. It was, however, listed on Spanish websites and was only about a year old so we thought it would be a safe bet. My husband and i had just spent a week on a cruise and 4 nights in Barcelona and this hotel was fantastic! It is right on the beach, all rooms face the Mediterranean with floor to ceiling glass doors that open up, and the decor is modern and very clean. Unlike the last review, we found the service to be outstanding- they allowed us to check in at 10am in the morning, completed our wake up call for 4am and had a car waiting to take us to the airport for 4:30am. Everyone we dealt with was pleasant and spoke English. We thought the pool was beautiful- it was a big oval pool completed with Mediterranean blue tiles and the whole pool is no deeper than 4 feet (it's meant for dipping- not diving). The chairs around the pool were very comfortable and they even had lovely cabanas (at no extra charge) that had pillows, blinds, etc. If you wanted to hit the beach instead, access was right next to the hotel- but we preferred the quite and cleanliness of the pool. It is literally a 7 minute drive to the airport and is really ideal for a quite day or 2 either before or after exploring the city. There are planes often going overhead but you don't hear it in the rooms at all. Ensure that before you get into a taxi that you have the directions to get there as some taxi's don't know anything outside of the city. we ended up paying 35 Euros as our driver had to keep getting out to ask for directions. This is a definite gem and we will most certainly return there again if cruising out of Barcelona.

HotelInfo.Name: AC Hotel Gava Mar by Marriott
HotelInfo.Address: C/ Tellinaires 35, 08850 Barcelona, Spain
